Package fr.sorbonne_u.components.cyphy.plugins.devs.interfaces

Component interfaces for DEVS simulation in a cyber-physical component model based on BCM.

See: Description

  • Interface Summary 
    Interface Description
    EventsExchangingCI
    The component interface EventsExchangingCI declares the method used to propagate events among models and simulation engines in a DEVS simulation.
    ModelDescriptionCI
    The component interface ModelDescriptionCI declares the methods that can be used to get information from simulation models directly or through their simulation engine or any other proxy reference.
    ParentNotificationCI
    The component interface ParentNotificationCI declares the methods used by child models to notify their parent models about the processing of external events.
    SimulationManagementCI
    The component interface SimulationManagementCI declares the methods used by simulation engines to manage simulation runs.
    SimulatorCI
    The component interface SimulatorCI declares the core behaviour of DEVS simulation engines.
    SimulatorPluginManagementCI
    The component interface AtomicSimulatorPluginManagementCI declares the methods for the management of simulator plug-in.
    SimulatorPluginManagementI
    The interface SimulatorPluginManagementI declares the methods for the management of simulator plug-in.
    SupervisorNotificationCI
    The component interface SupervisionCI is the component interface version of SupervisionI.
    SupervisorNotificationI
    The interface SupervisionI defines the methods through which simulators communicate with the simulation supervisor to provide it with informations on them, like register in a distributed simulation and sending a simulation report at the end of the runs.
    SupervisorPluginManagementCI
    The component interface SupervisorPluginManagementCI declares the methods used by supervisor components to create and connect simulation architectures.
    SupervisorPluginManagementI
    The interface SupervisorPluginManagementI declares the methods offered by the supervisor plug-in to the components holding them to create and connect simulation architectures.

Package fr.sorbonne_u.components.cyphy.plugins.devs.interfaces Description

Component interfaces for DEVS simulation in a cyber-physical component model based on BCM.

Licence

Copyright Jacques Malenfant, Sorbonne Universite.

Jacques.Malenfant@lip6.fr

This software is a computer program whose purpose is to provide an extension of the BCM component model that aims to define a components tailored for cyber-physical control systems (CPCS) for Java.

This software is governed by the CeCILL-C license under French law and abiding by the rules of distribution of free software. You can use, modify and/ or redistribute the software under the terms of the CeCILL-C license as circulated by CEA, CNRS and INRIA at the following URL http://www.cecill.info.

As a counterpart to the access to the source code and rights to copy, modify and redistribute granted by the license, users are provided only with a limited warranty and the software's author, the holder of the economic rights, and the successive licensors have only limited liability.

In this respect, the user's attention is drawn to the risks associated with loading, using, modifying and/or developing or reproducing the software by the user in light of its specific status of free software, that may mean that it is complicated to manipulate, and that also therefore means that it is reserved for developers and experienced professionals having in-depth computer knowledge. Users are therefore encouraged to load and test the software's suitability as regards their requirements in conditions enabling the security of their systems and/or data to be ensured and, more generally, to use and operate it in the same conditions as regards security.

The fact that you are presently reading this means that you have had knowledge of the CeCILL-C license and that you accept its terms.

This package is a part of a library that integrates DEVS simulation models in Java with the BCM component model also written in Java. DEVS allows to define modular simulation models that are composed through coupled models by interconnecting them in order to exchange events. Coupled models also play a coordination role when executing simulation runs by repeatedly selecting their next submodel having a transition to be executed and giving them the control to perform the transition.

When integrating DEVS with BCM, modular simulation models will be distributed among components. Hence, when calls or data exchanges will be needed among them, these will have to use BCM component interfaces, ports and connectors. This package defines the necessary component interfaces.
